title: 'I'm back on the hunt!' The Bachelor's Emma Roche reveals what she's looking for in a man
text:
She failed to find love with Matt Agnew during the last season of The Bachelor.

But Emma Roche remains anything but pessimistic when it comes to finding the one - and on Saturday confirmed she's very much 'on the hunt' to find her perfect man.

Speaking to Daily Mail Australia at Tribe Skincare's 2nd birthday at Bucket List Bondi, Emma revealed she's up for dating anyone, be it in the public eye or not.

Pretty in pink! Emma Roche (pictured) opened up about her single status at Tribe Skincare's 2nd birthday at Bucket List Bondi

'I don't really mind at all,' Emma - who recently blasted rumours she was dating Married At First Sight villain Dean Wells - revealed.

'As long as they're a decent guy, and we've got things in common, then it doesn't matter.

'If you're in the public eye, that's totally fine... or if you're an accountant, then that's fine too!'

'As long as they're a decent guy, and we've got things in common, then it doesn't matter' Emma confirmed she's still on the hunt for love after failing to find it on The Bachelor

And while admitting she's wary of returning to a dating app to find love, she reacted coyly when asked if she'd sign up for a stint on Bachelor In Paradise.

'Never say never...' she smiled. 'Yeah, look I mean, I don't know... I don't know if another dating show would be so good. I feel funny about that question!

'Me hanging around in a bikini, I don't know if people will want to see that!

Just friends! Dean Wells (right) shocked fans earlier this month, after he uploaded a photo of himself looking cosy with Emma at an event - leading people to believe that the pair were an item

'Look, never say never. I think I'm probably open to other opportunities rather than another dating show.'

Emma was recently forced to deny a romance with Married At First Sight hunk Dean Wells, after an image emerged of the duo cuddling up together on Instagram.

Discussing the snap, Emma laughed: 'I looked terrible! Everyone thought I was dating Dean, but he's just a really good friend.

'He's been really supportive of me throughout the whole process.'
description: She failed to find love with Matt Agnew during the last season of The Bachelor.
authors: Nicole Douglas For Daily Mail Australia
